intro: Hieracium orophilon, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture and a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are yellow with prominent central disc florets. Hieracium orophilon is known for its resilience to harsh climatic conditions, making it a common sight in alpine meadows.
